list_of_reviews.review_title: Support team have no accountability
list_of_reviews.review: This exchange and it's support team seems to think ERC20 and Ethereum Mainnet are synonymous. They are not. There are many chains that support ERC20 tokens. On Bybit's deposit page, they list ERC20 as a "Chain" you can deposit to, which is completely ambiguous because many chains support ERC20. Once you deposit your funds to a chain that supports ERC20 (In my case Base chain), they do not show up, because the only supported chain is actually Ethereum Mainnet, and the support team take no accountability. This is extremely poor...I spent 3 days arguing with support about whether the name of Ethereum Mainnet is ERC20 or not. You need to skill your support team up - they are completely incapable...To add a cherry on top, they say it will take 7 more working days to send the funds back - but in the meantime they completely closed my support ticket, so I had to open a new one.Avoid this exchange.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Support team have no accountability
list_of_reviews.review: This exchange and it's support team seems to think ERC20 and Ethereum Mainnet are synonymous. They are not. There are many chains that support ERC20 tokens. On Bybit's deposit page, they list ERC20 as a "Chain" you can deposit to, which is completely ambiguous because many chains support ERC20. Once you deposit your funds to a chain that supports ERC20 (In my case Base chain), they do not show up, because the only supported chain is actually Ethereum Mainnet, and the support team take no accountability. This is extremely poor...I spent 3 days arguing with support about whether the name of Ethereum Mainnet is ERC20 or not. You need to skill your support team up - they are completely incapable...To add a cherry on top, they say it will take 7 more working days to send the funds back - but in the meantime they completely closed my support ticket, so I had to open a new one.Avoid this exchange.

list_of_reviews.review: Forget trying to buy crypto on this site if you are in any asian country. It is useless. All they offer is purchase by credit card. You are asked to enter your name. I am in Taiwan. My credit card name is in English. My ID (which was used for the KYC) is in Chinese. They won't let you enter your name in Chinese when adding the card. Thus when it goes to process the transaction it fails because the name on the ID and the card don't match. KYC is supposed to be used to prevent money laundering. This purchase is for less than $100 US. I am sure money launderers are making $100 deposits (/sarc) . There should be a threshhold above a certain amount  where KYC has to be used.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Support team have no accountability
list_of_reviews.review: This exchange and it's support team seems to think ERC20 and Ethereum Mainnet are synonymous. They are not. There are many chains that support ERC20 tokens. list_of_reviews.review_title: Support team have no accountability
list_of_reviews.review: This exchange and it's support team seems to think ERC20 and Ethereum Mainnet are synonymous. They are not. There are many chains that support ERC20 tokens. On Bybit's deposit page, they list ERC20 as a "Chain" you can deposit to, which is completely ambiguous because many chains support ERC20. Once you deposit your funds to a chain that supports ERC20 (In my case Base chain), they do not show up, because the only supported chain is actually Ethereum Mainnet, and the support team take no accountability. This is extremely poor...I spent 3 days arguing with support about whether the name of Ethereum Mainnet is ERC20 or not. You need to skill your support team up - they are completely incapable...To add a cherry on top, they say it will take 7 more working days to send the funds back - but in the meantime they completely closed my support ticket, so I had to open a new one.Avoid this exchange.

I am writing here to appeal to bybit because I have funds blocked there and I need to use them urgently. I have already sent all the necessary supporting documents and I don't understand why it's taking so long. My UID: 54298383

list_of_reviews.review_title: Bybit P2P becomes worse and worse
list_of_reviews.review: Bybit P2P becomes worse and worse. Support? It’s impossible to contact them.I am seller on P2P. Same buyer did 2 orders with total amount 12500 USD, mark that he paid without payment. He have no any proof of payment, no responses, appeal team don’t look for this case more than 10 days. I wrote to support, they promise to answer within 5-7 days. No response within more than 7 days.Already moving to other platform. And will avoid make deals on Bybit in future and will share my experience with others.UPD. 4 days later. Nothing changed, just 2 more appeals added, total amount of stucked funds 16000 USD.I am “verified advertiser” with “Priority assistance from Bybit Customer Support”😂.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Urgent Assistance Needed: Bybit Account Review
list_of_reviews.review: 🙏 I keep all my savings here because I have full trust in Bybit. Even the money I received from my retired father, I've invested it here. I have all the necessary documents. Please help, all my money is here.A person contacted me in March to purchase RDP and logo design services. They made payments via ETH more than four times, and the latest was $200 worth of ETH. However, I couldn't see it in my wallet. Later, when I checked my email, I found the message: 'We are conducting a review of the deposit transaction(s) made to your Bybit account, which was/were found to have exposure to scam.' Then, I saw this: 'The information related to the transaction(s) in question, totaling US$200.04, is as follows: List of TXID(s) -0x713a41cf283e5c3d125e7d4ed5fce902fdb4be00a4c2b39abd9c98d13186dab0 List of Address(es) -0x9814ead8a2c51f542c565c8d1b0c526facdbb214.' Please help, I am not a scammer. It is true that the money came from my client, but there was no money in my wallet when I checked. I believe my client's wallet has been involved in a scam, but I was unaware of this. That wallet does not belong to me. I have screenshots (dialogues with my client) proving that it is not mine, and I don't understand why I am being blamed.Please, for Allah's sake, help me. I am 22 years old, and I have invested all my savings in Bybit for over a year. My money, including my family's, is currently temporarily restricted. Please help.I buy and sell physical rental servers in Germany and also provide logo design services to foreigners.You can check that there are at least 30 deposit transactions to my wallet every month, and I have been using it for over a year. This is first time I've encountered such a problem.I am asking for your help to expedite this process, please help me for Allah's sake.UID: 75419275Case number: 10006306

I have canceled my account and hope to never run into you again.  I will tell everyone what happened and how you approach people.

list_of_reviews.review_title: BYBIT NOT RECOMMENDED - LIKELY A SCAM!
list_of_reviews.review: Bybit provides substantially misleading information about their service (withdrawal limits of 46.5keur are changed arbitrarily to 20keur) are on their website and then they deny to transact withdrawals in spite of Level 2 KYC & having provided (confirmed by bybit compliance by email) additional. I have waited for 1 week now to get anything but robot-generated emails upon my FULLY QUALIFIED withdrawal request. From a confirmation I can only dream: the support-email address meanwhile provides NO concrete information. Strongly recommend not to transact over bybit as this service may be a scam!   The bybit answer in Trustpilot comes BEFORE I have received ANY REPLY with their UID and case number by bybit support!!! The reply is a smoke & mirrors reply. Do not such marketers, who do not value their customer.

list_of_reviews.review_title: No response to Support Case and frozen funds!
list_of_reviews.review: Case ID: 09810204Bybit UID: 121119390I recently contacted Bybit's support team to relinquish my status as a P2P Merchant and to release my frozen funds amounting to 1000 USD. Unfortunately, my experience has been extremely frustrating and disappointing.Despite clearly outlining my request, I did not receive any response from the support team. To make matters worse, my case was prematurely marked as "solved" without any resolution. My funds remain frozen, and my status as a P2P Merchant has not been changed.What is particularly concerning is that my case has been neglected for over a week without any acknowledgment or action. This prolonged lack of communication and failure to address my issue is unacceptable. As a result, I am compelled to give Bybit a 1-star rating due to the poor handling of my case. It is crucial for a platform to have responsive and effective customer support, and Bybit has fallen short in this regard.I hope that Bybit takes this feedback seriously and improves their support services to prevent such issues in the future!!!!UPDATE: Bybit has responded to me and was able to solve my issue. Although it took some time for the problem to be resolved, it was ultimately fixed accurately and satisfactorily. As a result, I will be increasing my rating.

I mean what the hell? They could not say this before I made a registration and uploaded my passport phot?? Why they even allow Serbia on the list to be able to sign up if service is not possible to be used? What's the point of having account without being able to use it? I won't even comment on their live chat support, down to the bottom worst service.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Bybit a scam ?
list_of_reviews.review: I've recently sold some SOL coins on this plattform. When I tried to withdraw the fiat funds (a 3 figure € amount) Bybit suddenly required KYC Lv. 2 verification to process the request. This, bybit had never done before. Up to now, Lv1 clearance (which is my level) was all that's required to retrieve such an amount. Since the helpdesk could not be reached in order to resolve the issue, a recent bank statement with my name (spelled correctly) and my address (up to date, correct, registered with bybit) was submitted to obtain the dubious Lv. 2 clearance to make a fiat withdrawal possible. Merely seconds after uploading the document, it was rejected out of hand, WRONGLY claiming it had been falsified and my account was blocked. ....laughable!Helpdesk has of course not responded so far... and I am wondering now, if bybit has become a scam.UID 164203224

list_of_reviews.review_title: Bybit a scam ?

Since the helpdesk could not be reached in order to resolve the issue, a recent bank statement with my name (spelled correctly) and my address (up to date, correct, registered with bybit) was submitted to obtain the dubious Lv. 2 clearance to make a fiat withdrawal possible. list_of_reviews.review_title: I was in a trade
list_of_reviews.review: I was in a trade, 30% in profit, then my browser suddenly became unresponsive. I could see everything normally, but my stoploss could not move, and i could not sell my order. Nothing worked. But i was not being logged out, neither could i refresh the site with f5. All other tabs/sites were working fine. I was stressing hard and decided to log onto my phone, but it took some time to find it, and the phone was indeed working. But alas, now my trade had reversed. This lasted some minutes. I got the feeling that i was locked out in a moment of high volatility. This was during a 1.5% drop in btc price in matter of minutes. I do no longer trust this site.Got this response from bybit, TAKING NO RESPONSIBILITY:Details regarding the reported order:Contracts: BTCUSDTOrder Time(UTC) : 2024-08-15 19:37:21 According to our investigations, we can confirm that your Stop Loss order was placed accurately without any glitches and system work properly. Please allow us to share some key points that traders need to be aware of when trading on Bybit: If the trading page is unresponsive, traders need to perform a browser page refresh.a) Perform a browser page refresh before starting any trading activities to ensure the restarting of inactive data feed to your Bybit UI, which is caused by prolonged periods of inactivity.b) According to our investigation, the Bybit platform was trading and operating optimally at the time of your order placing.c) Since Bybit is an online trading platform, traders are highly encouraged to follow the following guide to optimize both their device and network performance to ensure the best trading experience on Bybit.We hope that answers your inquiry regarding your liquidation. Please do not hesitate to contact us again should you require any assistance. Thank you.THIS IS A TOTAL LIE FROM BYBIT AND ALL MY FUNDS HAVE BEEN WITHDRAWN. USED TO TRUST THEM, (2021), BUT NOW THEY HAVE GONE BAD.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Unfair Accusations and Terrible Support
list_of_reviews.review: My experience with Bybit has been extremely disappointing. This was my first trading platform in the world of cryptocurrency, and I sincerely hoped for a positive experience. I registered through a referral link, completed full verification using my passport and biometric data, funded my account, and started participating in various newcomer promotions. However, things quickly went downhill.After several months, I was denied the bonuses I had expected. I was accused of allegedly creating duplicate accounts and engaging in fraudulent activities, which is absolutely untrue. My registration was my first and only one, and I used the platform solely for legitimate trading and to meet the requirements of the promotions. Moreover, I lost over $100 in trading and could not have gained any of the benefits they claimed.Reaching out to customer support was fruitless. For months, I received the same generic responses, pointing to vague "secret" rules, but they never explained clearly where and how I had supposedly violated them. Even when I provided evidence to defend myself, they continued to insist that their system detected suspicious activity, even though I was simply using the exchange as intended. While access to my account and withdrawals remained intact, this does not change the fact that I was wrongfully accused and stripped of the bonuses I worked hard to earn.Bybit needs to seriously improve their customer support system, make their investigations transparent, and ensure fairness. It’s hard to trust an exchange that can't explain its decisions and ignores genuine user concerns.I cannot recommend this platform to beginners or anyone who values fair treatment.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Terrible customer support
list_of_reviews.review: Terrible customer support! I tried to provide EDD documents, but their button in the app were not clickable. Over 2 months I tried to contact them and opened multiple tickets to provide the docs. At the end they blocked my crypto card and I still didn’t receive any response. And it is rediculous, because I personally worked in Binance customer support 1 year ago and I know how things should work. Bybit has unprofessional staff and poor management in customer support, they are not able to address issues effectively.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Entire assets wiped out
list_of_reviews.review: I started using bybit about 2 months ago. I made sure I completed my KYC before making any deposits and start trading, following after an advice from one of the victims of their sharp practices. I would never have decided to do business with them if not of the restrictions imposed on many of the other CEX by the government of my country.After completing my KYC, l made a deposit of about $65 in usdt, as well as an airdrop of about  $Dogs 31,127 tokens on the platform. I've been actively trading on the platform for about two months before the occurrence of this incident. I woke up on the 5th of September to monitor a couple of trades I already had in progress, only to discover that the app refused to launch on startup. I contacted a friend who also trades on the app if he was having the same experience to ascertain if it was a general problem. I sent a mail to the Bybit support after discovering it was not. I didn't receive any response from them, apart from an automated reply promising to respond between 5-7 working days. A few days after that I decided to give it another try and the app launched. But couldn't login to my account using the compulsory 2FA Google Authenticator. Eventually, I was able to log in using my Google account. To my surprise and horror I discovered that my entire assets has been wiped out. To further add salt to injury, I was required to do another round of verification and proceed to make further deposits before I can start trading.Before now each time I logged into my account I would see "verified lv 2 user" next to my profile.All this bears the Hallmark of a Rougue CEX. Please Bybit I need the restoration of all my assets, including my active trades.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Entire assets wiped out
list_of_reviews.review: I started using bybit about 2 months ago. I made sure I completed my KYC before making any deposits and start trading, following after an advice from one of the victims of their sharp practices. I would never have decided to do business with them if not of the restrictions imposed on many of the other CEX by the government of my country.After completing my KYC, l made a deposit of about $65 in usdt, as well as an airdrop of about  $Dogs 31,127 tokens on the platform. I've been actively trading on the platform for about two months before the occurrence of this incident. I woke up on the 5th of September to monitor a couple of trades I already had in progress, only to discover that the app refused to launch on startup. I contacted a friend who also trades on the app if he was having the same experience to ascertain if it was a general problem. I sent a mail to the Bybit support after discovering it was not. I didn't receive any response from them, apart from an automated reply promising to respond between 5-7 working days. A few days after that I decided to give it another try and the app launched. But couldn't login to my account using the compulsory 2FA Google Authenticator. Eventually, I was able to log in using my Google account. To my surprise and horror I discovered that my entire assets has been wiped out. To further add salt to injury, I was required to do another round of verification and proceed to make further deposits before I can start trading.Before now each time I logged into my account I would see "verified lv 2 user" next to my profile.All this bears the Hallmark of a Rougue CEX. Please Bybit I need the restoration of all my assets, including my active trades.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Awesome exchange
list_of_reviews.review: Awesome exchange I use on a daily basis.Great offers, a bunch of different pairs to trade on both Spot and Derivative market. Pleasant user interface. A lot of passive earn opportunities (Bybit Earn, Launchpool, Liquidity Mining, Wealth Management, and so much more!)Built-in Web3 integration, NFT marketplace. Most importantly - works in Russia, no issues (unlike some other exchanges). Copytrading, MT5 integration - pretty useful for ones who know how to work with these!Awesome API for developers, out-of-the-box trading bots for non-developers. Fairly transparent system with a comprehensive Knowledge Base explaining basically all concepts you need to know to trade on the exchange.Loving it! <3

list_of_reviews.review_title: Awesome exchange
list_of_reviews.review: Awesome exchange I use on a daily basis.Great offers, a bunch of different pairs to trade on both Spot and Derivative market. Pleasant user interface. A lot of passive earn opportunities (Bybit Earn, Launchpool, Liquidity Mining, Wealth Management, and so much more!)Built-in Web3 integration, NFT marketplace. Most importantly - works in Russia, no issues (unlike some other exchanges). Copytrading, MT5 integration - pretty useful for ones who know how to work with these!Awesome API for developers, out-of-the-box trading bots for non-developers. Fairly transparent system with a comprehensive Knowledge Base explaining basically all concepts you need to know to trade on the exchange.Loving it! <3

list_of_reviews.review_title: Stupid asset freeze with no warning via p2p
list_of_reviews.review: I have been using bybit services for 2 years. I encountered a problem with p2p. The main user agreement is that you are responsible for your own funds. Nothing bad has ever happened for two years. Today I made a purchase in p2p for 426$, two hours later I had to pay with cryptocurrency. And then when withdrawing I see a small inscription that funds are frozen. Damn... in tech support they say their "super" security system can do this because of anomalous activity or something. I hadn't made any transactions for a week up to that point. Oh yeah, I wasn't even warned in any way that funds could be frozen. Although their "super" system should have shown a "T+1" notification window, but that didn't happen. As they said in tech support, you need to clean the cache. Everyone clears their cache before opening p2p, right? Extremely disappointed, if I had known I would have bought via telegram. My order would be: 1838268731174543360. UID: 37089389. I can make more arguments for the wrongness of bybit. Apparently the guys find "free money" for liquidity that way.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Bybit
list_of_reviews.review: I requested to close the account I opened on Bybit and have my personal data permanently deleted. I think this period was kept unnecessarily long and I was constantly delayed without my demands being met.I clearly see that Bybit does not comply with the laws and KVKK in Turkey. list_of_reviews.review_title: Bybit Refund Stuck for Over 20 Days
list_of_reviews.review: On September 6, 2024, I made a €10,000 SEPA deposit into my Bybit account. After waiting for days and not seeing the funds credited to my account, I contacted Bybit's customer support. They informed me that the deposit would be refunded, and I provided all the necessary documents.However, every time I reach out to their support, I’m told to wait another 7 days. It’s now been over 20 days since the initial deposit, and I still haven’t received the refund. I’ve even been told by their live chat agents that my case is being "expedited," but there have been no real updates. I’m starting to lose trust in the platform.UPDATE - 30 SEPTEMBER 2024:After weeks of waiting and several follow-ups, Bybit finally credited the funds, but not in the way I had requested. Instead of refunding the money to my bank account, the funds were credited to my Bybit wallet, causing further confusion and inconvenience. This inefficiency led to the loss of a valuable investment opportunity.While the issue is partially resolved, Bybit needs to significantly improve how they handle customer requests and their response times. Overall, this experience was disappointing.

list_of_reviews.review_title: ***SCAM ALERT***
list_of_reviews.review: ***SCAM ALERT*** Bybit requires facial recognition EVERY time you wish to make a withdrawal. After passing login (i.e. username, password, email auth, 2FA)  then to do just a simple withdrawal you must complete again ... email auth, then 2FA auth, and also facial recognition! In short, Bybit requires that you have a working camera on your PC and do facial recognition EVERY time you wish to withdraw your funds. If the camera or facial recognition doesn't work, you are SOL, because writing out to customer service does nothing to resolve the problem. This is NOT common industry practice. They do this to keep your funds and not let you withdraw. They claim security or safety for the user - this is a lie and pretext to make it as hard as possible to access your funds when you need them. This is disingenuous.***STAY AWAY***

Nothing bad has ever happened for two years. Today I made a purchase in p2p for 426$, two hours later I had to pay with cryptocurrency. And then when withdrawing I see a small inscription that funds are frozen. Damn... in tech support they say their "super" security system can do this because of anomalous activity or something. I hadn't made any transactions for a week up to that point. Oh yeah, I wasn't even warned in any way that funds could be frozen. Although their "super" system should have shown a "T+1" notification window, but that didn't happen. As they said in tech support, you need to clean the cache. Everyone clears their cache before opening p2p, right? Extremely disappointed, if I had known I would have bought via telegram. My order would be: 1838268731174543360. UID: 37089389. I can make more arguments for the wrongness of bybit. Apparently the guys find "free money" for liquidity that way.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Bybit
list_of_reviews.review: I requested to close the account I opened on Bybit and have my personal data permanently deleted. According to the Personal Data Protection Law No. 6698 (KVKK) valid in TurkeyEven though I contacted customer service many times, they told me that they would continue to store my personal data. This situation is clearly against Turkish law. They also said that due to the process, their investigation will take 5-7 days. I think this period was kept unnecessarily long and I was constantly delayed without my demands being met.I clearly see that Bybit does not comply with the laws and KVKK in Turkey. It is unacceptable for my personal data security and rights to be disrespected in this way. I will apply to the necessary authorities to protect my legal rights. I request Bybit to fix this situation and advise other users to be careful to avoid the same situation.UID: 100126386

list_of_reviews.review_title: The worst cryptoexchange platform ever
list_of_reviews.review: The worst cryptoexchange platform ever. This is my first-ever review on the internet. I usually hold my comments when it comes to any bad service considering it as a potential coincidence. But this platform made me absolutely furious. They blocked my savings due to "suspicious activity" stating that someone may have accessed my funds. I checked, and only I performed any actions on my account. IT HAS BEEN TWO MONTHS since they barely do anything - they don't have any live support and share only scripted replies with no additional comments. And yes they usually reply once per week or two. Hence for two months straight all the money that I've been saving for years is taken from me. NEVER USE THIS PLATFORM unless you are willing them to "secure" your funds from yourself

list_of_reviews.review_title: Bybit Refund Stuck for Over 20 Days
list_of_reviews.review: On September 6, 2024, I made a €10,000 SEPA deposit into my Bybit account. After waiting for days and not seeing the funds credited to my account, I contacted Bybit's customer support. They informed me that the deposit would be refunded, and I provided all the necessary documents.However, every time I reach out to their support, I’m told to wait another 7 days. It’s now been over 20 days since the initial deposit, and I still haven’t received the refund. I’ve even been told by their live chat agents that my case is being "expedited," but there have been no real updates. I’m starting to lose trust in the platform.UPDATE - 30 SEPTEMBER 2024:After weeks of waiting and several follow-ups, Bybit finally credited the funds, but not in the way I had requested. Instead of refunding the money to my bank account, the funds were credited to my Bybit wallet, causing further confusion and inconvenience. This inefficiency led to the loss of a valuable investment opportunity.While the issue is partially resolved, Bybit needs to significantly improve how they handle customer requests and their response times. Overall, this experience was disappointing.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Disappointing Experience with Bybit - Order Execution Issues and Unreliable Support
list_of_reviews.review: UID 50714378 My experience with Bybit has been highly unsatisfactory. Initially, I used the platform to execute Stop Loss orders to minimize losses effectively. However, I ended up facing unexpected losses due to incorrect order execution, along with conflicting information provided by the support team regarding the settings I chose.Detailed Order Information:1. Order ID: e659527eContract: BANANAUSDTOrder Type: Partial Limit Stop LossDirection: Close ShortQuantity: 282.38Trigger Price: 46.17Order Price: 46.17Status: CanceledOrder Cancelled Time (UTC): 2024-10-04 10:02:082. Order ID: b29c05abContract: BANANAUSDTOrder Type: MarketFilled Quantity: 282.38/282.38Filled Price: 46.831Status: FilledSummary of the Issue: I set a Stop Loss order using the correct settings, including choosing "Partial Stop Loss" to mitigate risks. However, the order was not executed when the trigger price of 46.17 was reached. Instead, the order was completely canceled. Later, a market order was executed at 46.831, which is significantly higher than the price I specified, leading to an unexpected loss.My Experience with Customer Support: I reached out to the support team multiple times for clarification and compensation regarding the losses. However, there were inconsistencies in their responses:During the chat with support, I was told that I had used the "Reduce Only" option, while in the email response, I was informed that the order was a "Partial Limit Stop Loss." This inconsistency in information indicates a lack of credibility from the support team.When I requested compensation for the losses caused by the incorrect execution, I received no clear answer regarding the refund, and my request was continuously ignored, which left me feeling extremely frustrated.Conclusion: I expected Bybit, as a globally recognized trading platform, to be more professional and transparent in handling customer issues, especially when system errors lead to financial losses. However, my experience has been filled with contradictions and frustration due to incorrect order execution, conflicting information provided by support, and avoidance of any compensation for the losses.My Final Request: I demand full compensation for the amount lost due to this execution error, and I warn any trader against trusting the platform without verifying its reliability and customer service.

list_of_reviews.review: I have been using bybit services for 2 years. I encountered a problem with p2p. The main user agreement is that you are responsible for your own funds. Nothing bad has ever happened for two years. Today I made a purchase in p2p for 426$, two hours later I had to pay with cryptocurrency. And then when withdrawing I see a small inscription that funds are frozen. Damn... in tech support they say their "super" security system can do this because of anomalous activity or something. I hadn't made any transactions for a week up to that point. Oh yeah, I wasn't even warned in any way that funds could be frozen. Although their "super" system should have shown a "T+1" notification window, but that didn't happen. As they said in tech support, you need to clean the cache. Everyone clears their cache before opening p2p, right? Extremely disappointed, if I had known I would have bought via telegram. My order would be: 1838268731174543360. UID: 37089389. I can make more arguments for the wrongness of bybit. Apparently the guys find "free money" for liquidity that way.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Bybit

list_of_reviews.review_title: ***SCAM ALERT***
list_of_reviews.review: ***SCAM ALERT*** Bybit requires facial recognition EVERY time you wish to make a withdrawal. After passing login (i.e. username, password, email auth, 2FA)  then to do just a simple withdrawal you must complete again ... email auth, then 2FA auth, and also facial recognition! In short, Bybit requires that you have a working camera on your PC and do facial recognition EVERY time you wish to withdraw your funds. If the camera or facial recognition doesn't work, you are SOL, because writing out to customer service does nothing to resolve the problem. This is NOT common industry practice. They do this to keep your funds and not let you withdraw. They claim security or safety for the user - this is a lie and pretext to make it as hard as possible to access your funds when you need them. This is disingenuous.***STAY AWAY***

list_of_reviews.review_title: [WITHRAWAL BAN (RESOLVED) 21.10.2024
list_of_reviews.review: I was beyond frustrated with my experience at Bybit. A few weeks ago, my crypto debit card stopped working, and shortly after, they blocked my ability to withdraw any funds. While I could still trade, I was completely locked out of accessing my own money, which was incredibly infuriating.I complied with every verification request, including sending a selfie video with my ID and a handwritten note, plus both the front and back of my ID and driver's license. Despite my efforts, I received nothing but automated responses from support for over three weeks.After escalating the issue by reaching out to higher-ups globally at Bybit, the problem was finally resolved faster than I expected—but only because I had to make a scene. Thankfully, I was able to withdraw my funds. However, the stress and uncertainty made me realize the importance of owning your private keys. I’ll never use a centralized exchange (CEX) again.Not your keys, not your coins—I had to learn that the hard way by almost losing everything I worked hard for. While my issue is resolved now, I still cannot recommend Bybit after such a stressful experience.

list_of_reviews.review_title: [WITHRAWAL BAN (RESOLVED) 21.10.2024
list_of_reviews.review: I was beyond frustrated with my experience at Bybit. A few weeks ago, my crypto debit card stopped working, and shortly after, they blocked my ability to withdraw any funds. While I could still trade, I was completely locked out of accessing my own money, which was incredibly infuriating.I complied with every verification request, including sending a selfie video with my ID and a handwritten note, plus both the front and back of my ID and driver's license. Despite my efforts, I received nothing but automated responses from support for over three weeks.After escalating the issue by reaching out to higher-ups globally at Bybit, the problem was finally resolved faster than I expected—but only because I had to make a scene. Thankfully, I was able to withdraw my funds. However, the stress and uncertainty made me realize the importance of owning your private keys. I’ll never use a centralized exchange (CEX) again.Not your keys, not your coins—I had to learn that the hard way by almost losing everything I worked hard for. While my issue is resolved now, I still cannot recommend Bybit after such a stressful experience.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Disappointed with Bybit's Handling of Airdrop Rewards
list_of_reviews.review: Review: I recently participated in an airdrop and received 15 TON as a reward, which I was initially excited about. However, that excitement quickly turned to frustration when I discovered that Bybit has my TON rewards frozen with no clear explanation or timeline for when I can access them. Reaching out to customer service has been unhelpful, as responses are either vague or non-committal. For a platform that promotes itself as user-friendly and reliable, this experience has been extremely disappointing. If Bybit wants to build trust and maintain its reputation, it needs to improve transparency and user support. Until then, I would caution others to be wary when participating in similar promotions on their platform."I am willing to provide my UID to Bybit if they wish to investigate my case further."

list_of_reviews.review_title: I’m disappointed with Bybit’s MT5 platform because of it's limited crypto trading pairs
list_of_reviews.review: I’m disappointed with Bybit’s MT5 platform due to the limited selection of crypto trading pairs. There are only 30 pairs available, which makes it frustrating and almost unusable for anyone looking to trade a broader range of cryptocurrencies. For a platform as big as Bybit, it’s surprising that so few pairs are listed on MT5. They should add the other pairs to make the platform fully usable and to provide traders with the flexibility they need. Please consider expanding the selection to improve the trading experience for your users.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Bybit is one of the best crypto cex
list_of_reviews.review: Bybit is one of the leading crypto exchanges available today. While it’s not perfect, they are continually growing and putting in significant effort to scale their platform and deliver quality services. Many of the negative reviews here seem to stem from issues related to P2P transactions, where some users have unfortunately encountered scams from other users. While Bybit could improve in handling these cases, it’s important to recognize that these incidents are not solely the platform’s fault. They have shown dedication to improving their support and security over time.Beyond P2P, Bybit offers a wide range of features and tools for crypto traders and enthusiasts, setting it apart from many other exchanges. I believe the current ratings are not fully reflective of the overall service quality that Bybit provides, especially considering their ongoing efforts and improvements.

To improve user satisfaction, the service should focus on enhancing personalization, streamlining processes to reduce wait times, and ensuring consistent and effective customer support. While Bybit could improve in handling these cases, it’s important to recognize that these incidents are not solely the platform’s fault. They have shown dedication to improving their support and security over time.Beyond P2P, Bybit offers a wide range of features and tools for crypto traders and enthusiasts, setting it apart from many other exchanges. I believe the current ratings are not fully reflective of the overall service quality that Bybit provides, especially considering their ongoing efforts and improvements.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Unacceptable Service and Lack of Support
list_of_reviews.review: ⭐️I am writing this review with a heavy heart and a sense of deep frustration. I have been a loyal customer of Bybit for over two years, but the recent experience I've had with their customer service has left me in a state of disbelief and financial distress.A year ago, I lost my device and with it, my access to 2FA. I immediately reached out to Bybit's support team, providing them with all necessary identification and recent transaction details. Despite being a KYC verified account holder, I was met with an unreasonable demand - a video recording of the source account linked to the first transaction into my Bybit account from two years ago. This request is not only impractical but also impossible to fulfill logistically.The lack of understanding and empathy from the support team is astounding. I have been left in the dark, with no clear information on what's happening or why I am being denied access to my own funds. This has resulted in significant financial loss and personal distress.The inability of a company to service a simple reset of 2FA, especially when all necessary details have been provided, is unacceptable. It's been a year of back and forth with no resolution in sight. I am at a loss for words to describe the level of disappointment and frustration I feel.I urge potential users to consider this experience before choosing Bybit. The lack of effective customer support and the unreasonable demands placed on customers in times of distress is a red flag. Your funds may not be as accessible as you think. It’s been a year I’ve had access to mine.

list_of_reviews.review: I've had a great experience using Bybit, particularly with its demo trading feature. It’s been instrumental in sharpening my skills and understanding key aspects of cryptocurrency trading. The real-time data simulation, paired with practice funds of over $150k, has provided an excellent learning environment.Also, the P2P trading feature has been reliable for all my USDT needs, with minimal risk involved, which gives me confidence in using it regularly.While my experience so far has been positive, I look forward to exploring more of Bybit’s products and features!

list_of_reviews.review_title: 2000 EUR in fees for a single transaction
list_of_reviews.review: Last month I made my fifth BTC deposit to Bybit. The previous ones were accepted fine, but within a minute the system automatically flagged this one as abnormal for some reason. I was not given an opportunity to appeal or provide details. With other exchanges, banks and the tax agency I've never had an issue with KYC/AML as I can provide documentation, but I was never given that option with Bybit.My only option was to withdraw the BTC to a new address with a fee of 0.025 BTC, over 1000x higher than the actual network fee, and at the time worth about 2000 EUR. I was lured in with the cashback, gamification and offers, but it ended up costing me money instead of saving.Beware if you make crypto deposits to Bybit they can without explanation flag it as abnormal and take huge fees from you. If you wish to deposit crypto instead choose an exchange where compliance is reachable and run by humans, not automated.Two stars instead of one because the support employees I had contact with did take time for me, but ultimately were not able to explain why my deposit was flagged or restore the fee, and compliance never responded to me.

list_of_reviews.review_title: 2000 EUR in fees for a single transaction
list_of_reviews.review: Last month I made my fifth BTC deposit to Bybit. The previous ones were accepted fine, but within a minute the system automatically flagged this one as abnormal for some reason. I was not given an opportunity to appeal or provide details. With other exchanges, banks and the tax agency I've never had an issue with KYC/AML as I can provide documentation, but I was never given that option with Bybit.My only option was to withdraw the BTC to a new address with a fee of 0.025 BTC, over 1000x higher than the actual network fee, and at the time worth about 2000 EUR. I was lured in with the cashback, gamification and offers, but it ended up costing me money instead of saving.Beware if you make crypto deposits to Bybit they can without explanation flag it as abnormal and take huge fees from you. If you wish to deposit crypto instead choose an exchange where compliance is reachable and run by humans, not automated.Two stars instead of one because the support employees I had contact with did take time for me, but ultimately were not able to explain why my deposit was flagged or restore the fee, and compliance never responded to me.Case number: 13319149

list_of_reviews.review_title: Bybit exchange attracts new customers by spreading deliberately false advertising
list_of_reviews.review: Bybit exchange attracts new customers by spreading deliberately false advertising. For example, I was offered a reward of 10 USDT for registration, passing KYC and making a deposit of $100. After I fulfilled these conditions and tried to collect 10 USDT, an error notification popped up, and then all mention of these unfortunate 10 USDT disappeared altogether. The support team first started lying that the task was allegedly not completed on time, to which they provided evidence of their lies. Then they came up with a new excuse, like the reward reserve was exhausted. But then in this case, why deceive the client by slipping him a dummy? After all, the task did not say anywhere that it was a lottery, but, on the contrary, it was clearly stated: top up the deposit from $100 - get 10 USDT.Below my review there will be a response from the absolutely useless Bybit support, about how sorry they are (they don't really care) with a suggestion to contact support to solve any problems (in fact it is absolutely useless, they are not able to solve any problems).

list_of_reviews.review_title: Unreliable Platform and Poor Technical Support

Bybit is unable to write stable code, which means your funds could disappear at any moment.Due to errors in the platform's operation, both my funds and account were affected—my coins simply vanished from my balance. This isn’t a case of market volatility or price drops; on Bybit’s Web3 platform, your purchased crypto can simply disappear, and their support team will be of no help.It seems to me that Bybit is cutting costs on technical expertise, focusing only on marketing. I don’t believe they intentionally stole my funds, but their poor technical implementation poses a serious risk to users. The fact that even they seem unaware of the root cause suggests it’s down to incompetent coding.For Bybit employees: my support ticket number is 13580228.

prompts_output.Prompt: Considering the date, rating, title, and content of the review: Extract key phrases and words that frequently appear in the reviews, which might indicate common areas of concern or praise for bybit.com. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Key phrases include "user-friendly interface," "innovative features," "active customer service," "reliability," and "community." These suggest praise for Bybit's ease of use, innovation, customer support, and community engagement. Concerns may include "deposit still under review," indicating potential issues with transaction processing times.

prompts_output.Prompt: Considering the date, rating, title, and content of the review: Calculate the average rating from the reviews and analyze the distribution of ratings to understand the general user satisfaction level. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The average rating from the reviews is 4 ((3+5)/2). With one high rating and one moderate rating, user satisfaction appears generally positive, suggesting that while some issues may arise, they are often resolved, leading to overall favorable experiences.

prompts_output.Prompt: Considering the date, rating, title, and content of the review: Generate concise review summary to capture the gist of user opinions without needing to read through each review fully. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The review initially criticized the content as a scam due to a low rating but was updated after issue resolution, highlighting human-generated posts with specific project details and personalized engagement, distinguishing them from bot-generated content.

prompts_output.Prompt: Considering the date, rating, title, and content of the review: Contrast the topics mentioned in positive reviews with those mentioned in negative reviews to determine key differentiators in user experiences. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Positive reviews highlight specific project details, collaboration, and personalized engagement, while negative reviews focus on unresolved issues and lack of these elements. The key differentiator is personalized, context-specific content and successful issue resolution in positive experiences.

prompts_output.Prompt: Considering the date, rating, title, and content of the review: Analyze mentions of customer support interactions in the reviews to gauge the effectiveness and responsiveness of the bybit.com support team. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The reviews highlight Bybit's active and effective customer support, with one user specifically praising the "active customer service" and no reported issues, indicating a positive and responsive support experience.

overall_prompt_summary: The reviews reveal that positive experiences are characterized by personalized engagement, collaboration, and context-specific content, which are crucial in distinguishing human-generated posts from bot-generated ones. Negative reviews often arise from unresolved issues and a lack of these personalized elements, highlighting the importance of effective issue resolution. The average rating of 4 suggests a generally positive user satisfaction, indicating that while issues may occur, they are frequently addressed, leading to favorable outcomes. A critical issue identified is the initial perception of content as a scam, which was later rectified through successful issue resolution and clarification of content authenticity. To improve further, there should be a focus on enhancing personalized engagement and ensuring prompt resolution of issues to prevent negative perceptions and maintain user trust.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Copy trading "Maximum Drawdown" is a bit misleading
list_of_reviews.review: I want to inform copy-traders that the Maximum Drawdown (MDD) displayed for master traders can be very misleading. It doesn’t account for unrealized losses, which are crucial to consider. For example, I followed a trader with a 0% MDD over 7 days, 2.50% MDD over 30 days and 3% MDD over 90 days, but yesterday, their entire portfolio was down 20%. Some traders can even go 30–40% negative before closing an order, and if they eventually close it on profit, the MDD still shows as 0% (this is the example from yesterday: they close the trade on profit yesterday, despite being over 20% on the negative, and the MDD over 7 days is still 0%).Couldn't there be an option to show both realized/unrealized MDD? This would help copy traders make a better decision.
